Submodules¶

faulttolerance.errors module¶

Load a error model for the specified parameters. The error model must be in the folder data/ following the name format stablished by decomposition/tools/names.py.

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 21/08/17

class faulttolerance.errors.Generator(surface, ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta, protocol)¶

Bases: object

get_errors(num_errors, stabilizer, border=False)¶

Get a list of errors corresponding to the loaded error model.

num_errors : (int) number of stabilizers measured on which errors are
applied

stabilizer : (string) plaq or star, type of the stabilizer measured border : (bool) if the stabilizer measured is in the border of the

planar code

faulttolerance.errors_test module¶

faulttolerance.layers module¶

Layers class for holding the measurement sheets when performing imperfect measurements on the surface code.

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 12/07/17

class faulttolerance.layers.Layers(surface_code)¶

Bases: object

Layers to store the syndrome measurements in the surface codes. Works as a 3d surface code where time is the third dimension.

add()¶

Add the current measuement status as another layer.

decode(weights=[1, 1])¶

Decode the measured syndromes using MWPM

find_anyons(stabilizer)¶
find_anyons_all()¶

Return all the stabilizer measuements so far

get_time()¶

Returns the number of measurements done so far

reset()¶

Erases all saved syndroms

faulttolerance.matching module¶

Functions for performing the decoding of the surface code. Relies on Kolmogorov’s implementation of the Blossom algorithm: Blossom V

faulttolerance.matching.add_virtual_space(size, anyons, stabilizer)¶
faulttolerance.matching.add_virtual_time(total_time, anyons)¶
faulttolerance.matching.make_graph(size, nodes, N_real, weights, cyclic=True)¶
faulttolerance.matching.match(size, anyons, surface, stabilizer, time, weights)¶

Find a matching to fix the errors in a 3D planar code given the positions of ‘-1’ stabilizer outcomes

size : (int) The dimension of the code anyons : (list) A list of the locations of all ‘-1’ value stabilizers.

[[x0,y0,t0],[x1,y1,t1],…]

surface : (string) planar or toric, the surface of the code time : (int) Number of syndrome extractions made under imperfect measurements

time = 0 assumes perfect syndrome extractrion and the decoding is in 2D.
weights : (list) The multiplicative weighting that should be assigned to graph
edges in the [space,time] dimensions. Default: [1,1]

A list containing all the input anyon positions grouped into pairs. [[[x0,y0,t0],[x1,y1,t1]],[[x2,y2,t2],…

faulttolerance.matching.match_simple(size, anyons, surface, stabilizer, weights)¶

Find a matching to fix the errors in a 3D planar code given the positions of ‘-1’ stabilizer outcomes

NOTE: REQUIRES LAST PERFECT MEASUREMENT ROUND

size : (int) The dimension of the code anyons : (list) A list of the locations of all ‘-1’ value stabilizers.

[[x0,y0,t0],[x1,y1,t1],…]

surface : (string) planar or toric, the surface of the code weights : (list) The multiplicative weighting that should be assigned to graph

edges in the [space,time] dimensions. Default: [1,1]

A list containing all the input anyon positions grouped into pairs. [[[x0,y0,t0],[x1,y1,t1]],[[x2,y2,t2],…

faulttolerance.matching.pairs_remove_out_planar(size, total_time, stabilizer, pairs)¶
faulttolerance.matching.pairs_remove_out_planar_space(size, stabilizer, pairs)¶
faulttolerance.matching.pairs_remove_out_toric(total_time, pairs)¶

faulttolerance.original_surface_code_test module¶

faulttolerance.surface_code module¶

Surface code simulation class.

created on: 19/07/17

@author: eduardo

class faulttolerance.surface_code.SurfaceCode(distance, surface)¶

Bases: object

Surface code class for either the toric or planar surfaces.

Q – S – Q – S – Q – S –
| |
P Q P Q P Q
| |
Q – S – Q – S – Q – S –
| |
P Q P Q P Q
| |
Q – S – Q – S – Q – S –
| |
P Q P Q P Q
| |
Implements the operations:
  • Stabilizer measurement
  • Random noise
  • Noisy operations
  • Measurement errors

All the information is saved on the (2, 2*distance, 2*distance) array qubits qubits[0] - X error and stabilizer measurements qubits[1] - Z error, stabilizer entries are not used

apply_measurement_error(p_lie)¶

Add measurement error to BOTH stars and plaqs stabilizers.

apply_qubit_error(pX, pZ)¶

Apply random error to the data qubits.

correct_error(stab_type, match, time=0)¶

Apply error corrections resulting from de decoding process. Uses MWPM as a decoder.

stab_type : (string) stabilizer type where corrections are being applied match : (list) matchings obtained from the decoder. time : (int) if imperfect measurements, number of measuements made

environmental_noise(p)¶

Add environmental depolarizing noise. See decomposition/errors.py

get_plaqs()¶

Get the values of all plaq qubits.

get_stars()¶

Get the values of all star qubits.

init_error_obj(surface, ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta, protocol)¶

Initialize a error objecto to load an error model.

surface : (string) planar or toric code ps : (scalar) single qubit gate error rate. pm : (scalar) measurement error rate. pg : (scalar) two qubit gate error rate. eta : (scalar) detection efficiency. a0 : (scalar) extra environmental error when electron spin is being operated. a1 : (scalar) default environmental error. theta : (scalar) determines how the states are initialized when generating remote

entanglement.

protocol : (string) name of the protocol used in generating the states

init_error_obj_extra(surface, ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta, protocol)¶
measure_all_stabilizers(p_not_complete=0)¶

Measure all stabilizer in the code.

p_not_complete : (scalar) probability that a stabilizer is not able
to complete the measuement in time
measure_logical()¶

Meausure the logical qubits.

measure_stabilizer_type(stabilizer, p_not_complete=0)¶

Measure ALL stabilizers of a given type.

stabilizer: (string) either “star” or “plaq”

measurement_protocol_hybrid()¶

Noisy stabilizer measuement cylce following with maximum parallelization for a distributed surface code with the hybrid scheme.

measurement_protocol_local()¶

Noisy stabilizer measurement cycle for the monolithic arquitecture.

measurement_protocol_single()¶

Noisy stabilizer measuement cylce following with maximum parallelization for a distributed surface code.

measurement_protocol_single_rounds()¶

Noisy stabilizer measuement cylce following the insterspersed stabilizer rounds protocol for a distributed surface code.

measurement_protocol_single_rounds_rev()¶

Noisy stabilizer measuement cylce following the insterspersed stabilizer rounds protocol for a distributed surface code.

noisy_measurement(stabilizer)¶

Return useful parameters for stabilizer type.

noisy_measurement_cycle()¶

Execute a measurement cycle with the selected protocol.

noisy_measurement_specific(pos, c, stabilizer, reverse=False)¶
noisy_measurement_specific_extra(pos, c, stabilizer)¶
plot(stabilizer)¶

Plot the surface code given stabilizer.

stabilizer : (string) “star” or “plaq”.

plot_all()¶

Plot the surface code stabilizers.

plot_rounds()¶

Plot the stabilizer sequence for the given protocol.

reset()¶

Reset surface code to default configuration.

select_measurement_protocol(t, a, protocol, p_not_complete=0.0)¶

Select measuement protocol depending on the number of data qubits per node.

p_env : (scalar) time it took to generate a GHZ state between nodes a : (list) [a0, a1] paramters for the environmental error protocol : (string) protocol in with stabilizer measurements are made

separate_bulk_boundary(pos)¶
